issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A fix has been committed, and will be part of the next release
status.name: Release Pending

fields.summary: cloudformation stack fails to add tags to launched instances

comments.body:
Customer again tried to execute another stack template and ended up with same problem.  The ASG group has tag names but the instance does not have tag name.

Here is the instance which came up without tag name

{code}
RESERVATION     r-ef49e629      000036372732    default
INSTANCE        i-cb791de1      emi-6ae0c7a4    euca-10-129-140-201.eucalyptus.es-si-eu-dhn-20.eecloud.nsn-net.net      euca-10-254-75-159.eucalyptus.internal  running petri.ojala.ext@nokia.com       0               m1.small        2017-06-20T06:24:33.319Z        es-si-eu-dhn-20_3                               monitoring-enabled      10.129.140.201  10.254.75.159                   instance-store                                  hvm             9f5a53b8-b164-46b4-b540-e8c18ccca9ca_es-si-eu-dhn-20_3_1        sg-605fb068                             x86_64
TAG     instance        i-cb791de1      aws:autoscaling:groupName       pojala-bug-tue-8-MyASG-JOBMB8DCZQA40
{code}

Here is euscale-describe output for the ASG group "pojala-bug-tue-8-MyASG-JOBMB8DCZQA40"

{code}
TAG     pojala-bug-tue-8-MyASG-JOBMB8DCZQA40    auto-scaling-group      aws:cloudformation:logical-id   MyASG   true
TAG     pojala-bug-tue-8-MyASG-JOBMB8DCZQA40    auto-scaling-group      aws:cloudformation:stack-id     arn:aws:cloudformation:es-si-eu-dhn-20:000036372732:stack/pojala-bug-tue-8/1c4d6210-ba50-4318-a18f-96e245798b1e true
TAG     pojala-bug-tue-8-MyASG-JOBMB8DCZQA40    auto-scaling-group      aws:cloudformation:stack-name   pojala-bug-tue-8        true
TAG     pojala-bug-tue-8-MyASG-JOBMB8DCZQA40    auto-scaling-group      test:tag:1      testvalueA      true
TAG     pojala-bug-tue-8-MyASG-JOBMB8DCZQA40    auto-scaling-group      test:tag:2      testvalueB      true
{code}

I have attached text files collected from customer.

When cloudformation creates an autoscaling group there are two separate steps for the initial creation of the group and then adding tags to the group. I assume that what occurs is that the instances are launched before the tags have been added to the group. If this is the case then terminating the instances should cause them to be replaced with ones with the expected tags.

If this is what is occurring then a fix would be to initially create the autoscaling group with min/max/desired capacity of zero, add the tags to the group and then set the min/max/desired capacity to the final values. This would ensure no instances are launched until the tags are set.

To check if this is what occurs, you could look at the stack events:

{code}
# euform-describe-stack-events STACK_NAME_HERE
{code}

and check the timing of the "AWS::AutoScaling::AutoScalingGroup" events against the instance creation times to see if autoscaling group creation was completed before instances were launched.

To reproduce this issue I added a delay in cloudformation autoscaling group creation. I'm not sure if this can otherwise be reproduced. 

The fix addresses scaling occurring before tags are added to the autoscaling group. It is not clear if this is the issue the customer is seeing.

Auto scaling is unusual case since the tags on one resource propagate to other resources. I think the only other resource type that has work on creation similar to an autoscaling group is an elb (AWS::ElasticLoadBalancing::LoadBalancer), but an elb resource would not have the same issue with tags since they are not propagated.
[~sjones], So what is the final solution to this problem ?   How can it be fixed ?
[~kshaik], this issue is fixed by adding the tags to the autoscaling group before any instances are launched.
[~sjones], this ticket can be closed down.  We had already closed the zendesk ticket as we did not receive reply from them.
Nothing to fix here. Issue was resolved by adding tags directly to the Auto Scaling group.

This issue is fixed for 4.4.2 in the commit:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/commit/e0917bb2ba0d2fe7427e57321a46e6b08ec17c42
[~sjones], ah okay.  I was going from the last few comments in the ticket.  I will test it out.  Thanks for hitting me back up with this one.

*Eucalyptus Version*

{{4.4.1-0.25930.61.20170731git17c94f6.el7}}

*Steps*

# Set up Eucalyptus 4.4 cloud using Edge networking mode - [hspencer-839-maint-4.4|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Maint_4.4/839/]
# Created non-eucalyptus account (e.g. development-operations)
# Using linked {{cfn-elb-asg-tagging-template.json}} template, deployed stack.  Template contains the following:
#* 5 tags with {{"PropagateAtLaunch": "true"}} option
#* 60 second sleep on each instance thats launched
{code}
[root@g-12-10 ~]# euform-create-stack NginxStack --template-file cfn-elb-asg-tagging-template.json --parameter ImageId=emi-44c4f596 --parameter KeyName=devops-admin --parameter InstanceType=m1.medium --parameter EndPoint=http://cloudformation.d-23.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ --capabilities CAPABILITY_IAM --region devops-admin@
arn:aws:cloudformation::000897607864:stack/NginxStack/4020efc0-7648-4d44-b9f3-163d1eb54796
[root@g-12-10 ~]# euform-describe-stacks --region devops-admin@
STACK	NginxStack	CREATE_COMPLETE		AWS CloudFormation Sample Template AutoScalingSingleAZ: Create a single-az, load balanced and Auto Scaled sample web site running on an Nginx Web Server. The application is configured to span in one availability zone (one cluster) and is Auto-Scaled based on the CPU utilization of the web servers.	2017-08-04T01:52:00.514Z
PARAMETER	InstanceType		m1.medium
PARAMETER	ImageId		emi-44c4f596
PARAMETER	KeyName		devops-admin
PARAMETER	EndPoint		http://cloudformation.d-23.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
PARAMETER	MinSize		2
PARAMETER	MaxSize		4
OUTPUT	URL	http://NginxSta-ElasticLo-UEEGNMQ6FJ2F2-000897607864.lb.d-23.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
[root@g-12-10 ~]# curl -I http://NginxSta-ElasticLo-UEEGNMQ6FJ2F2-000897607864.lb.d-23.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.10.3 (Ubuntu)
Date: Fri, 04 Aug 2017 02:13:06 GMT
Content-Type: text/html
Content-Length: 612
Last-Modified: Fri, 04 Aug 2017 01:54:20 GMT
ETag: "5983d3cc-264"
Accept-Ranges: bytes

{code}
# Confirmed tagging was correct:
{code}
